direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods validate top-level domains but focus on different types (country code vs. generic/infrastructure/local).
Both methods validate top-level domains but focus on different types (generic vs. country code/infrastructure/local).
Both methods validate top-level domains but focus on different types (infrastructure vs. country code/generic/local).
Both methods validate top-level domains but focus on different types (local vs. country code/generic/infrastructure).
The isValid method relies on isValidTld to validate the top-level domain part of the domain name.
Both methods validate domain-related strings but focus on different aspects (syntax vs. top-level domain validity).
The unicodeToASCII method is used by isValidTld to convert domain names to ASCII before validation.
The chompLeadingDot method is used by isValidTld to handle leading dots in top-level domains.
The arrayContains method is used by isValidTld to check if a top-level domain exists in predefined arrays.
